This was done on the 2nd of March 1944. After some time one Leon Setton of Cairo lodged a claim against Flight-Lieutenant Clements in the Mixed Courts, Cairo. Mr. Bevin is aware that there is no power under the law of Bahrein to execute the Order of the Egyptian Court, and he is advised that it would be necessary for the successful plaintiff to start proceedings in Bahrein upon his judgment if he is to levy execution on the values in question. Unless, however, Lord Pethick Lawrence sees any objection, he would be glad if the Political Resident at Bahrein could be asked to cause the documents to be ^ served on the Bank in order that the latter may be aware era* the existence of the Attachment Order. It would be understood that in the absence of an Order by the Bahrein Court on proceedings instituted there by the plaintiff, the Bank would be under no obligation to give effect to the Order of the Egyptian Court or liability for failing to do so. I am. 9BRITISH EMBASSY CAIRO BCF/PSR N0.422 25th March 1946 (503/33/46) Sir I have the honour to report that i February last at the request of the Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs copies of a judicial document issued by the Ministry of Justice for service on the Eastern Bank Limited at its branch office at Bahrein, were sent to the Political Resident, Bushire, with a request that the com petent authorities should serve the documents on the defendants. The Political Resident replied that he was unable to carry out this request as there is no provision of law or treaty applicable to Bahrein under which the courts there are empowered to effect service of documents issued by Egyptian courts. 2. The Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs were informed of the decision of the Political Resident and they have now requested in their Note, a copy of which is attached, that the Political Resident should be asked to reconsider his decision. 3. It seems difficult to believe that there is no method by which the service of this document could be effected, and before finally replying to the Egyptian Government I have the honour to request that the question may be taken up again with the Political Resident at Bahrein through the competent authorities in the United Kingdom. The documents in question are enclosed herein. I have the honour to be with the highest respect, Sir, Your most obedient, humble Servant, (Sgd.) titleInfo.title: Coll 29/54(1) 'Serving of an attachment order issued by the Egyptian Court on the Bahrain branch of the Eastern Bank Ltd'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 22; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file concerns a request by the Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs to provide copies of a judicial document issued by the Egyptian Ministry of Justice regarding the service on the Bahrain Branch of the Eastern Bank Limited.The file is composed of correspondence between the British Embassy in Cairo; the Foreign Office; and the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf.There are some documents in French, from the Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
